main_definition: Encryption is the process of converting information or data into a code to prevent unauthorized access.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of transforming plain text into ciphertext using an encryption algorithm
meanings_and_examples.example: Alice uses AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) to encrypt her personal emails.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A method or technology used for securing data by encoding it so that only authorized parties can read it
meanings_and_examples.example: The company implemented SSL encryption on their website to secure online transactions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An approach in cryptography where information is converted into a format that obscures its true meaning
meanings_and_examples.example: Bob encrypted his credit card number before sending it over the internet for an online purchase.
